001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
006
007/**
008 * A simple linear combination of the form:
009 * <pre>
010 *   f(x) = Σ w_i * x_i
011 * </pre>
012 * where the weights are trainable parameters.
013 * <p>
014 * This class supports forward estimation of the scalar output as well as
015 * calculation of parameter parameterGradients required for gradient-based training.
016 *
017 * @see AffineTransformation
018 */
019@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
020public class LinearCombination<N extends Number> implements TrainableScalarFunction<N> {
021
022    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
023    private Array<N> parameters;
024
025    /**
026     * Creates a new {@code LinearCombination} with the specified number of input dimensions.
027     * <p>
028     * The underlying parameter vector will have length {@code dimensions} representing the weights.
029     *
030     * @param dimensions number of input features
031     * @return a new {@code LinearCombination} instance with zero-initialized parameters
032     */
033    public static <N extends Number> LinearCombination<N> create(int dimensions, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
034        return new LinearCombination<>(typeSupport.createArray(dimensions), typeSupport);
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Constructs a {@code LinearCombination} with the given parameter vector.
039     *
040     * @param parameters parameter vector (weights)
041     */
042    public LinearCombination(Array<N> parameters, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
043        this.parameters = parameters;
044        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
045    }
046
047    @Override
048    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getNumberTypeSupport() {
049        return typeSupport;
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Estimates the scalar output of this linear model for the given input vector.
054     * <p>
055     * The computation is:
056     * <pre>
057     *   output = Σ (inputs[i] * weights[i])
058     * </pre>
059     *
060     * @param inputs the input feature vector
061     * @return the scalar output value
062     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code inputs.length != arity()}
063     */
064    @Override
065    public N estimateScalar(Array<N> inputs) {
066        if (inputs.length() != parameters.length()) {
067            throw new IllegalArgumentException();
068        }
069        N sum = typeSupport.zero();
070        for (int d = 1; d <= parameters.length(); d++) {
071            sum = typeSupport.add(sum, typeSupport.multiply(inputs.get(d - 1), getWeight(d)));
072        }
073        return sum;
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Calculates the parameterGradients of the output with respect to all parameters (weights)
078     * for the given input vector.
079     * <p>
080     * The gradient vector has length {@code arity()}, where:
081     * <ul>
082     *   <li>Indices 0..arity correspond to the input values, i.e. ∂f/∂w_i = input[i-1].</li>
083     * </ul>
084     *
085     * @param inputs the input feature vector
086     * @return the gradient vector (weight parameterGradients)
087     */
088    @Override
089    public Array<N> calculateParameterGradients(Array<N> inputs) {
090        return inputs;
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * {@inheritDoc}
095     */
096    @Override
097    public int getParameterCount() {
098        return parameters.length();
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Returns the full parameter vector of this model.
103     *
104     * @return the parameter array
105     */
106    @Override
107    public Array<N> getParameters() {
108        return parameters;
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * {@inheritDoc}
113     */
114    @Override
115    public N getParameter(int p) {
116        return parameters.get(p);
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * {@inheritDoc}
121     */
122    @Override
123    public void setParameters(Array<N> values) {
124        this.parameters = values;
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * {@inheritDoc}
129     */
130    @Override
131    public void setParameter(int p, N value) {
132        parameters.set(p, value);
133    }
134
135    /**
136     * Returns the number of input features this model accepts,
137     * equal to the number of weights (parameters.length).
138     *
139     * @return the arity (number of input dimensions)
140     */
141    @Override
142    public int arity() {
143        return parameters.length();
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Checks if a given dimension index is valid.
148     *
149     * @param d dimension index, starting from 1
150     * @return the same index if valid
151     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code d} is out of range
152     */
153    protected final int validDimension(int d) {
154        if (d < 1 || d > parameters.length()) {
155            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid dimension!");
156        }
157        return d;
158    }
159
160    /**
161     * Returns a copy of the weights (all parameters except the bias).
162     *
163     * @return the weight vector
164     */
165    public Array<N> getWeights() {
166        return parameters;
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Replaces all weights with the given vector.
171     *
172     * @param weights the new weight vector
173     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the number of weights does not match {@link #arity()}
174     */
175    public void setWeights(Array<N> weights) {
176        if (weights.length() != parameters.length()) {
177            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid number of weights!");
178        }
179        this.parameters = weights;
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Returns the weight for a given dimension (1-based).
184     *
185     * @param d dimension index, starting from 1
186     * @return the weight value
187     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code d} is out of range
188     */
189    public N getWeight(int d) {
190        return parameters.get(validDimension(d) - 1);
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * Sets the weight for a given dimension (1-based).
195     *
196     * @param d      dimension index, starting from 1
197     * @param weight the new weight value
198     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code d} is out of range
199     */
200    public void setWeight(int d, N weight) {
201        parameters.set(validDimension(d) - 1, weight);
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Adjusts the weight for a given dimension (1-based) by adding {@code delta}.
206     *
207     * @param d     dimension index, starting from 1
208     * @param delta the adjustment value
209     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code d} is out of range
210     */
211    public void adjustWeight(int d, N delta) {
212        parameters.set(d - 1, typeSupport.add(parameters.get(validDimension(d) - 1), delta));
213    }
214
215}
